greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of squares or twice squares dividing n.
link: Carl R. White, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Multiplicative with a(2^e) = e+1 and a(p^e) = floor(e/2)+1 for an odd prime p.
a(n) = A005361(2*n) for n>0 (conjectured). - _Werner Schulte_, Jan 15 2018
mathematica: f[n_] := Total[1 - (-1)^DivisorSigma[1, Divisors@n]]/2; Array[f, 105] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 02 2013 *)
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Dec 04 2001
